ood.database

Class HSQLDBWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • ood.database.HSQLDBWrapper

  • public final class HSQLDBWrapper
extends Object
    This class represent a SqlJet database contained into one file.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jason Mahdjoub

    • Constructor Detail

      • HSQLDBWrapper

        public HSQLDBWrapper(File _file_name)
              throws IllegalArgumentException,
                     DatabaseException
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        _file_name - The file which contains the database. If this file does not exists, it will be automatically created with the correspondent database.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if parameters are null pointers.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given file is a directory.
        DatabaseLoadingException - If a Sql exception exception occurs.
        DatabaseException

      • HSQLDBWrapper

        public HSQLDBWrapper(File _file_name,
                     int _cache_rows,
                     int _cache_size,
                     int _result_max_memory_rows,
                     int _cache_free_count)
              throws IllegalArgumentException,
                     DatabaseException
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        _file_name - The file which contains the database. If this file does not exists, it will be automatically created with the correspondent database.
        _cache_rows - indicates the maximum number of rows of cached tables that are held in memory. The value can range between 100- 4 billion. Default value is 100. Table loaded into memory are not concerned.
        _cache_size - Indicates the total size (in kilobytes) of rows in the memory cache used with cached tables. The value can range between 100 KB - 4 GB. The default is 10,000, representing 10,000 kilobytes.
        _result_max_memory_rows - This property can be set to specify how many rows of each results or temporary table are stored in memory before the table is written to disk. The default is zero and means data is always stored in memory. If this setting is used, it should be set above 1000.
        _cache_free_count - The default indicates 512 unused spaces are kept for later use. The value can range between 0 - 8096. When rows are deleted, the space is recovered and kept for reuse for new rows. If too many rows are deleted, the smaller recovered spaces are lost and the largest ones are retained for later use. Normally there is no need to set this property.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if parameters are null pointers.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given file is a directory.
        DatabaseLoadingException - If a Sql exception exception occurs.
        DatabaseException

      • HSQLDBWrapper

        public HSQLDBWrapper(URL _url)
              throws IllegalArgumentException,
                     DatabaseException
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        _url - The url pointing to the server which contains the database.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if parameters are null pointers.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given file is a directory.
        DatabaseLoadingException - If a Sql exception exception occurs.
        DatabaseException

      • runSynchronizedTransaction

        public <O> O runSynchronizedTransaction(SynchronizedTransaction<O> _transaction)
                                 throws Exception
        Run a transaction by locking this database with the current thread. During this transaction execution, no transaction will be able to be run thanks to another thread.
        Type Parameters:
        O - a type
        Parameters:
        _transaction - the transaction to run
        Returns:
        the result of the transaction
        Throws:
        Exception - if an exception occurs during the transaction running

      • checkPoint

        public void checkPoint(boolean _defrag)
                throws DatabaseException
        Closes the database files, rewrites the script file, deletes the log file and opens the database.
        Parameters:
        _defrag - If true is specified, this command also shrinks the .data file to its minimal size.
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - if a SQL exception occurs.
